CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The ratios between the hole and electron mobilities were calculated to be 3.2 and 13.6 for the POBDTPD : PC 70 BM blend and the PEBDTPD : PC 70 BM blend films , respectively.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| POBDTPD |
| PC 70 BM |
| PEBDTPD |
| PC 70 BM |

In the given paragraph, the "Material Name" entities are "POBDTPD", "PC 70 BM", "PEBDTPD", and "PC 70 BM". These are the names of the materials used in the blend films mentioned in the paragraph.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PC 70 BM |

In the given paragraph, the only clear "Material Name" entity is "PC 70 BM". This is the only material name that is unambiguously a material. The other entities, "POBDTPD" and "PEBDTPD", are not clearly material names without additional context.

The "Property Value" entities in the paragraph are the numerical values associated with the ratios of hole and electron mobilities for the two blends. These values are explicitly stated as 3.2 and 13.6.

The only entities that clearly refer to "Value of material property" are the numerical values associated with the ratios of hole and electron mobilities for the two blends. These values are explicitly stated as 3.2 and 13.6. The other entities in the paragraph, such as "The ratios between the hole and electron mobilities", "for the POBDTPD : PC 70 BM blend and the PEBDTPD : PC 70 BM blend films" are not values of material properties and are not included in the table.
